snippet: The party often promises to change, and then it nominates people like Trump....
abstract: Op-Ed article by public policy professor Leah Wright Rigueur argues historic lows in support for Donald J Trump from African-Americans is not entirely explained by candidate's perceived bigotry; blames Republican party's disconnect with minority voters on its long history of catering to white resentments, despite rhetorical gestures aimed at inclusion.
lead_paragraph: The party often promises to change, and then it nominates people like Trump.

headline.print_headline: Why the G.O.P. Can’t Win Black Votes
headline.main: Why Can’t the G.O.P. Get Real With Black Voters?
